comments:
Build ID: I20061102-1715

Steps To Reproduce:
When I ran the test suite on Eclipse 3.3M3 for Linux x86 with gtk, I got some test failures. They were as follows:

1 in coreruntime
7 in jdtdebug
147 in swt
49 in ui

What might be the reason for this ? How can I try to replicate the setup which eclipse.org uses for testing at our end ?

To give one example, the tests (testArchiveSourceContainerMemento to testAutoDetectUnqualifiedSourceLookupPositive) in jdtdebug failed. The failure message were similar to following:

----------------------------------
Did not find JRE source archive junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Did not find JRE source archive
at org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.sourcelookup.ExternalArchiveSourceContainerTests.getContainer(ExternalArchiveSourceContainerTests.java:56)
at org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.sourcelookup.ExternalArchiveSourceContainerTests.testArchiveSourceContainerMemento(ExternalArchiveSourceContainerTests.java:81)
at org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.AbstractDebugTest.runBare(AbstractDebugTest.java:1460)
at org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.DebugSuite$1.run(DebugSuite.java:53)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:567)
-----------------------------------------------


More information:
If the test results are needed, please let me know - i'll attach them.

For swt, you will have to configure your mozilla libraries to ensure that the browser tests can run.  

See 
http://www.eclipse.org/swt/faq.php#browserlinuxrcp

Also, was the userid running the tests logged logged into the machine via the GUI so they can own the tests?  

Also, please run the tests from the 3.3 release as 3.3M3 from last year.

Please attach the failing test cases if these suggestions don't solve your issue.
Please reopen if this is still an issue.

traces.message: Did not find JRE source archive
